title: Sketchbook Folio, "The Lupercalian Festivals", 1821–22
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over traces of black chalk on white heavy wove paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Lodovico Caraci Bologna; at lower left: 40 Lodovico Caraci Bologna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing, male figure in classical dress at center, with robe billowing behind him, rushing past smoking altar. Figure at right dancing. In background figures visible through smoke. Lower drawing figure in classical armor, apparently Romulus, at right directing ploughman with two oxen. Other figures at left removing(or setting) stones and timbers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sketchbook Folio, "The Lupercalian Festivals", 1821–22.
1821–22. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, over traces of black chalk on white heavy wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3578.
